clinical_study.brief_title: Factors Associated With Radiographic Pathophysiology for Trapeziometacarpal Arthrosis in Patients Not Seeking Care for This Condition
clinical_study.official_title: Factors Associated With Radiographic Pathophysiology for Trapeziometacarpal Arthrosis in Patients Not Seeking Care for This Condition

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are doing this research study to discover factors, such as job, hobbies, or race that are associated with arthrosis at the base of your thumb on X-rays. Thumb arthrosis is one of the most common kinds of arthritis. About 116 people will take part in this research study at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Trapeziometacarpal Arthrosis
primary_outcome.description: Radiographs were scored using the Eaton score range.The Eaton score ranges from 1-4 where 1 is the least severe and 4 is the most severe for arthritis. Patients without TMC Arthritis would have a score of 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: QuickDASH (Disability of the Arm, Shoulder, and Hand)

arm_group.description: Patients presenting to the Orthopaedic Hand Service not seeking care for TMC Arthrosis

intervention.description: X-ray as part of standard care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 55 years and older
- Not seeking care for TMC arthrosis from hand surgeon at the time of visit
- english fluency and literacy
Exclusion Criteria:
